org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry

Class SizeI

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.SizeI

  • public final class SizeI
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an extension in two-dimensional space, using Integer coordinates. SizeI contains two immutable non-negative Integer dimensions. Use SizeD to represent sizes with Double dimensions.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static SizeI EMPTY
      An empty read-only SizeI.
      int height
      The vertical dimension of the SizeI.
      int width
      The horizontal dimension of the SizeI.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SizeI()
      Creates a SizeI with zero extension.
      SizeI(int width, int height)
      Creates a SizeI with the specified extension.

    • Field Detail

      • width

        public final int width
        The horizontal dimension of the SizeI. Never negative.

      • height

        public final int height
        The vertical dimension of the SizeI. Never negative.

      • EMPTY

        public static final SizeI EMPTY
        An empty read-only SizeI. Both width and height are set to zero.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SizeI

        public SizeI()
        Creates a SizeI with zero extension. Both width and height are set to zero.

      • SizeI

        public SizeI(int width,
             int height)
        Creates a SizeI with the specified extension.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the SizeI.
        height - the height of the SizeI.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is less than zero

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public SizeI add(SizeI size)
        Adds the extension of the specified SizeI to this instance.
        Parameters:
        size - the SizeI whose extension to add to this instance
        Returns:
        a SizeI whose width and height equal the addition of the corresponding dimensions of the specified size to this instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the sum in any dimension overflows Integer
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if size is null

      • fromInts

        public static SizeI[] fromInts(int... sizes)
        Converts the specified Integer array to a SizeI array. The returned array has half as many elements as the specified sizes and retains the same dimension sequence.
        Parameters:
        sizes - an array containing the width and height components of SizeI instances, stored in alternating index positions
        Returns:
        the SizeI array created from sizes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sizes has an odd number of elements, or if any width or height is less than zero
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if sizes is null

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Determines whether the SizeI is empty.
        Returns:
        true if both width and height equal zero, else false

      • restrict

        public SizeI restrict(int minWidth,
                      int minHeight,
                      int maxWidth,
                      int maxHeight)
        Restricts the SizeI to the specified extension range.
        Parameters:
        minWidth - the smallest permissible width
        minHeight - the smallest permissible height
        maxWidth - the greatest permissible width
        maxHeight - the greatest permissible height
        Returns:
        a SizeI whose width and height equal those of this instance, restricted to the specified extension range
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if maxWidth or maxHeight is less than zero

      • subtract

        public SizeI subtract(SizeI size)
        Subtracts the extension of the specified SizeI from this instance.
        Parameters:
        size - the SizeI extension to subtract from this instance
        Returns:
        a SizeI whose width and height equal the subtraction of the corresponding dimensions of the specified size from this instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the difference in any dimension is less than zero
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if size is null

      • toInts

        public static int[] toInts(SizeI... sizes)
        Converts the specified SizeI array to an Integer array. The returned array has twice as many elements as the specified sizes and retains the same dimension sequence.
        Parameters:
        sizes - the SizeI array to convert
        Returns:
        an array containing the width and height components of all sizes, stored in alternating index positions
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if sizes or any of its elements is null

      • toSizeD

        public SizeD toSizeD()
        Converts the SizeI to a SizeD.
        Returns:
        a SizeD whose SizeD.width and SizeD.height equal the corresponding dimensions of the SizeI

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares the specified Object to this SizeI instance.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the Object to compare to this instance
        Returns:
        true if obj is not null and a SizeI instance whose width and height equal those of this instance, else false

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code for the SizeI.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        an Integer hash code for the SizeI

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the SizeI.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String containing the values of width and height
